sentence.Network_en: She asked him impishly to come in.

PerfectNetExp.abs: she asked him impishly to come in ., 她调皮地邀请他进来.

list.abs: the photograph of Christian that accompanied many of the news stories showed a boy with mussed-up hair and pierced ears with black plugs looking impishly askance at the camera .很多新闻报道配发了一张克里斯丁本人的照片，在那幅照片中是一个头发乱糟糟的男孩，耳朵插着一个黑色的耳塞，顽皮地斜视着相机的镜头。

entry.tran: 似顽童的;顽皮的;调皮的
entry.def: If you describe someone or their behaviour as impish, you mean that they are rather disrespectful or naughty in a playful way.

example.ex: Gillespie is well known for his impish sense of humour.
example.tran: 吉莱斯皮以他精灵搞怪的幽默感而广为人知。

means.word_mean: 1. in an appealing but bold manner;

sentences.sentence: "she asked him impishly to come in"

auth_sentence.content: She probably doesn't think so, he says impishly.
auth_sentence.res_content: She probably doesn't think so, he says impishly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She probably doesn't think so, he says impishly.

auth_sentence.content: Short in stature, immensely loquacious, impishly witty and equally affable to all, Nowlan was the quintessential Dubliner.
auth_sentence.res_content: Short in stature, immensely loquacious, impishly witty and equally affable to all, Nowlan was the quintessential Dubliner.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Short in stature, immensely loquacious, impishly witty and equally affable to all, Nowlan was the quintessential Dubliner.
